messages: 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (02:55): i hate when conversations become two-headed simultaneous "should we do this" and "how might we do this", heh
29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08 (03:01): Is there a website for testing web browser's conformance to HTML 4?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:09): 29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08: HTML4 was never defined with enough precision to be testable for conformance
29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08 (03:09): How can I explain that to others?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:10): What are you trying to convince them of?
29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08 (03:10): I need to explain that a web browser is better at displaying HTML4 than others.
29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08 (03:11): I have to find the web browser that renders HTML4 best.
29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08 (03:11): HTML4 was last published in Dec 1999.
29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08 (03:12): I guess all web browsers don't really differ in their capacity to render HTML4.
29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08 (03:12): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c, How do you think?

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:13): A web browser that implements what HTML4 specified will be worse in any real-world situations than one that doesn't (but that implements what HTML5 specifies instead)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:13): so HTML4 conformance is not a desirable quality (nor a well-defined one)
29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08 (03:13): How about HTML4 rendering capacity?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:13): HTML4 defines lots of stuff that is incompatible with how real web pages work
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:14): so browsers don't try to implement it
29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08 (03:14): What the hell
29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08 (03:14): What did the browsers render actually?
29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08 (03:14): If it wasn't HTML4, what was it?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:14): It was much more like what HTML5 now specifies
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:15): (since HTML5 is largely based on reverse-engineering what web browsers did)
29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08 (03:15): Things were close to HTML5 since 10 years ago
29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08 (03:15): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c, Are you a member of whatwg?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:16): "member" doesn't really mean anything in the WHATWG
29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08 (03:16): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c, Have you participated in whatwg activities?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:16): Anyone can join the mailing list or IRC etc and join discussions
29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08 (03:16): IRC and mailing list are everything in whatwg?
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (03:17): 29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08, the WHATWG is an adhocracy, only formally governed by the surpreme leader.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:17): That's where almost all communication occurs
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (03:17): IRC is for tasteless jokes and wonkery, mailing list for tasteless specs and wonkery.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (03:18): i have no idea what wonkery means, btw.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (03:18): but it sounds nice.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (03:18): let me look it up
29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08 (03:18): I already looked it up
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (03:19): wonkery (uncountable)
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (03:19): The quality or activities associated with being a wonk
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:19): hopes our supreme leader is careful to avoid over-work while on trains
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (03:19): wonk (plural wonks)
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (03:19): (derogatory) An overly studious person, particularly student; a nerd.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (03:19): (by extension) A policy wonk or other intellectual expert.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (03:19): that seems exactly right.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (03:20): TabAtkins, your explanation on premultiplied color spaces was fine, btw. i had to dig it out again to show someone four-dimensional thinking ^_^
29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08 (03:20): overwork?
29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08 (03:20): Does the leader have a job apart from being a leader?
29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08 (03:22): Does whatwg make HTML standard?
29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08 (03:24): "The WHATWG has a small, invitation-only steering committee called "Members", which has the power to impeach the editor of the specifications."
29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08 (03:24): Which group among whatwg and W3C made HTML5?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:24): 29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08: The editor is employed by Google to work on this stuff
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:26): The "Members" have never done anything (since the editor hasn't needed impeaching yet) so they're not a particularly important group
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:27): Have you seen http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/introduction.html#history-1 ?
29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08 (03:27): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c, Did W3C participate in making HTML5?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:29): Yes, a few years after the WHATWG started work on it
29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08 (03:31): I guess whatwg is the main contributor to HTML5.
29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08 (03:31): W3C wasn't really interested in HTML5.
29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08 (03:32): Now they are working together.

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:33): The main contributors to HTML5 are individuals, who either use the WHATWG processes (mailing list and IRC etc) or W3C processes (mailing list and bug tracker and issue tracker and decision process etc) or both
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:34): (The organisations don't really do anything by themselves, they just provide methods of communication)
29fbbbc353617fcd860dfb0132994d08 (03:36): people made HTML5 via whatwg and W3C chanels
bdf7d7409da19264fa0c4bf6b4f2d0cc (03:43): some organizations provide money to individuals in exchange for them working on specs
